sen.j: ガス灯（がすとう）は気体燃料の燃焼による照明。
sen.e: A gas light is illumination produced by burning a gaseous fuel.
A gas light is illumination produced by burning a gaseous fuel.
A gas light is illumination produced by burning a gaseous fuel.

sen.j: かつては室内灯としても使われたが、換気の問題などから、現在は街路灯としての使用が主である。
sen.e: While it was once used for interior lighting, it is now mainly used for street lighting as it causes the problem of ventilation.
While it was once used for interior lighting, it is now mainly used for street lighting as it causes the problem of ventilation.
While it was once used for interior lighting, it is now mainly used for street lighting as it causes the problem of ventilation.

sen.j: 魚尾灯
sen.e: Fishtail Burner
Fishtail Burner
Fishtail Burner

sen.j: 初期にガスを空気を少なくして燃やし裸火の炎の光を利用する、一文字灯やノズルを平たくした魚尾灯があった。
sen.e: In earlier times there were "Ichimonji lighting" which burned gas under reduced excess air to produce open flames as well as fishtail burners with flat nozzles.
In earlier times there were "Ichimonji lighting" which burned gas under reduced excess air to produce open flames as well as fishtail burners with flat nozzles.
In earlier times there were "Ichimonji lighting" which burned gas under reduced excess air to produce open flames as well as fishtail burners with flat nozzles.

sen.j: この当時のガス灯は一灯あたり、16燭光のものが標準的であったようである。
sen.e: At the time gas lights generally provided 16 candle powers per light.
At the time gas lights generally provided 16 candle powers per light.
At the time gas lights generally provided 16 candle powers per light.

sen.j: 白熱電球が発明された事により廃れる。
sen.e: They became obsolete when the incandescent light bulb was invented.
They became obsolete when the incandescent light bulb was invented.
They became obsolete when the incandescent light bulb was invented.

sen.j: 白熱ガス灯
sen.e: Incandescent Gas Light
Incandescent Gas Light
Incandescent Gas Light

sen.j: ガスマントルの発明により、一灯の出力が40燭光程度にまで伸びた物。
sen.e: The invention of a gas mantle increased light output per light to 40 candle powers, resulting in incandescent gas light.
The invention of a gas mantle increased light output per light to 40 candle powers, resulting in incandescent gas light.
The invention of a gas mantle increased light output per light to 40 candle powers, resulting in incandescent gas light.

sen.j: タングステン電球が普及するまでは相当数が用いられた。
sen.e: Incandescent gas lights were considerably used before the tungsten bulb became prevalent.
Incandescent gas lights were considerably used before the tungsten bulb became prevalent.
Incandescent gas lights were considerably used before the tungsten bulb became prevalent.

sen.j: 従来の裸火のガス灯と区別する為に白熱ガス灯という。
sen.e: They are so called to distinguish them from the traditional open-flame gas lights.
They are so called to distinguish them from the traditional open-flame gas lights.
They are so called to distinguish them from the traditional open-flame gas lights.

sen.j: 現在、見ることのできるガス灯は総てがこのガス灯である。
sen.e: They are currently used for gas lighting.
They are currently used for gas lighting.
They are currently used for gas lighting.

sen.j: ガスマントルは、カール・ヴェルスバッハの発明によるものである。
sen.e: The gas mantle was invented by Carl Auer von Welsbach.
The gas mantle was invented by Carl Auer von Welsbach.
The gas mantle was invented by Carl Auer von Welsbach.

sen.j: 麻やレーヨンの織物に硝酸セリウム・硝酸トリウムを含浸させたもの。
sen.e: It is made by saturating a hemp or rayon fabric with cerium nitrate or thorium nitrate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is made by saturating a hemp or rayon fabric with cerium nitrate or thorium nitrate.
It is made by saturating a hemp or rayon fabric with cerium nitrate or thorium nitrate.

sen.j: 一旦火を付け灰化させるとガスの炎で発光する。
sen.e: It emits radiation when heated and calcified by a gas flame.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It emits radiation when heated and calcified by a gas flame.
It emits radiation when heated and calcified by a gas flame.

sen.j: 昔から天然ガスは灯火や燃焼などに用いられていた。
sen.e: Natural gas was long used for lighting and combustion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Natural gas was long used for lighting and combustion.
Natural gas was long used for lighting and combustion.

sen.j: 照明としてのガス灯器具を最初に製作したのは、スコットランド人のウィリアム・マードックである。
sen.e: It was William Murdoch, a Scottish who first manufactured gas lighting equipment designed for lighting.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was William Murdoch, a Scottish who first manufactured gas lighting equipment designed for lighting.
It was William Murdoch, a Scottish who first manufactured gas lighting equipment designed for lighting.

sen.j: 1797年にイギリスのマンチェスターにおいてガス灯を設置している。
sen.e: In 1797 he installed gas lights in Manchester, England.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1797 he installed gas lights in Manchester, England.
In 1797 he installed gas lights in Manchester, England.

sen.j: 日本においても18世紀頃には、既に越後において「陰火」（いんか）として天然ガスの存在が知られいる。
sen.e: As early as in 18th century Japan natural gas was already known as "Inka" in Echigo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As early as in 18th century Japan natural gas was already known as "Inka" in Echigo.
As early as in 18th century Japan natural gas was already known as "Inka" in Echigo.

sen.j: ガスを灯火として用いた最古の記録としては、安政の大地震以前に南部藩の医師であった島立甫が、亀戸の自宅においてコールタールから発生させたガスを灯火として燃焼させたことが記されている。
sen.e: One of the earliest document on the use of gas for lighting gives the following account: Ryuho SHIMA, physician in Nanbu Domain, burned gas produced from coal tar to obtain lighting in his house in Kameido before the Ansei Great Earthquake.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: One of the earliest document on the use of gas for lighting gives the following account: Ryuho SHIMA, physician in Nanbu Domain, burned gas produced from coal tar to obtain lighting in his house in Kameido before the Ansei Great Earthquake.

One of the earliest document on the use of gas for lighting gives the following account: Ryuho SHIMA, physician in Nanbu Domain, burned gas produced from coal tar to obtain lighting in his house in Kameido before the Ansei Great Earthquake.

sen.j: （石井研堂『明治事物起原』より）。
sen.e: (Based on "Meiji jibutsu kigen" (Origins of Meiji Artefacts) by Kendo ISHII).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (Based on "Meiji jibutsu kigen" (Origins of Meiji Artefacts) by Kendo ISHII).
(Based on "Meiji jibutsu kigen" (Origins of Meiji Artefacts) by Kendo ISHII).

sen.j: その後も反射炉の燃焼ガスや鉱山の石炭ガスを燃焼させて灯火として燃やした例などがある。
sen.e: Other examples followed, including burning combustion gas from reverberatory furnaces or gas carbon in mines for illumination.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Other examples followed, including burning combustion gas from reverberatory furnaces or gas carbon in mines for illumination.
Other examples followed, including burning combustion gas from reverberatory furnaces or gas carbon in mines for illumination.

sen.j: 1857年（安政4年）には鹿児島県鹿児島市の仙巌園において、既存の灯籠にガスの管を繋ぎ、照明としてガスを燃焼させた。
sen.e: In 1857 Sengan Park in Kagoshima City, Kagoshima Prefecture attached a gas pipe to an existing stone lantern to burn gas for illumination.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1857 Sengan Park in Kagoshima City, Kagoshima Prefecture attached a gas pipe to an existing stone lantern to burn gas for illumination.
In 1857 Sengan Park in Kagoshima City, Kagoshima Prefecture attached a gas pipe to an existing stone lantern to burn gas for illumination.

sen.j: この装置の製作を命じたのは島津斉彬である。
sen.e: It was Nariakira SHIMAZU who ordered this equipment to be made.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was Nariakira SHIMAZU who ordered this equipment to be made.
It was Nariakira SHIMAZU who ordered this equipment to be made.

sen.j: 藩内各地において同様の装置を設置する構想も立てていたが、翌年の急逝で構想は流れた。
sen.e: Although he planned to install similar equipment across the domain, his plan was not materialized as he suddenly died in 1858.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although he planned to install similar equipments across the domain, his plan was not materialized as he suddenly died in 1858.
Although he planned to install similar equipments across the domain, his plan was not materialized as he suddenly died in 1858.

sen.j: 明治時代に入ってから本格的な西洋式ガス灯の照明器具が用いられるようになった。
sen.e: In the Meiji period full-fledged lighting equipment in Western style came to be used.
In the Meiji period full-fledged lighting equipments in Western style came to be used.
In the Meiji period full-fledged lighting equipments in Western style came to be used.

sen.j: 嚆矢は1871年（明治4年）大阪府大阪市の造幣局 (日本)周辺において。
sen.e: It was first used in 1871 in the neighborhood of the Japan Mint in Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was first used in 1871 in the neighborhood of the Japan Mint in Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.
It was first used in 1871 in the neighborhood of the Japan Mint in Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 機械の燃料として用いていたガスを流用する形で工場内および近隣の街路にてガス灯が点灯された。
sen.e: Gas fuels for machines were used for lighting gas lamps in the factory as well as street lights nearby.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Gas fuels for machines were used for lighting gas lamps in the factory as well as street lights nearby.
Gas fuels for machines were used for lighting gas lamps in the factory as well as street lights nearby.

sen.j: その時使われたガス灯の器具は現在も残されている。
sen.e: The gas lighting equipment used at the time is still preserved.
The gas lighting equipment used at the time is still preserved.
The gas lighting equipment used at the time is still preserved.

sen.j: 翌年の1872年（明治5年）9月1日に、神奈川県横浜市の伊勢山下石炭蔵跡（現在の中区 (横浜市)花咲町・本町小学校あたり）に横浜瓦斯会社が造られた。
sen.e: On September 1, 1872 Yokohama Gas Company was established in the former site of the Iseyamashita Coal Storehouse, Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture (around the present Honcho Elementary School in Hanasaki Town, Naka Ward, Yokohama City).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On September 1, 1872 Yokohama Gas Company was established in the former site of the Iseyamashita Coal Storehouse, Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture (around the present Honcho Elementary School in Hanasaki Town, Naka Ward, Yokohama City).

On September 1, 1872 Yokohama Gas Company was established in the former site of the Iseyamashita Coal Storehouse, Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture (around the present Honcho Elementary School in Hanasaki Town, Naka Ward, Yokohama City).

sen.j: ガス灯が一般事業として運営されるようになった。
sen.e: Gas lights were managed as general business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Gas lights were managed as general business.
Gas lights were managed as general business.

sen.j: 同年9月29日にガス灯が横浜の大江橋（桜木町駅近く現在の国道16号橋）から馬車道 (横浜市)・本町通界隈に設置された。
sen.e: On September 29 of the same year they were installed along the street running from Oe Bridge (the present National Route 16 Bridge near Sakuragicho Station) to the neighborhood of Bashamichi and Honcho in Yokohama City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On September 29 of the same year they were installed along the street running from Oe Bridge (the present National Route 16 Bridge near Sakuragicho Station) to the neighborhood of Bashamichi and Honcho Street in Yokohama City.

On September 29 of the same year they were installed along the street running from Oe Bridge (the present National Route 16 Bridge near Sakuragicho Station) to the neighborhood of Bashamichi and Honcho Street in Yokohama City.

sen.j: その他、屋内用の照明としても普及が見られるが、官公庁や裕福な家庭が中心であった。
sen.e: They were also widely used for interior illumination, though mainly in public offices and wealthy households.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were also widely used for interior illumination, though mainly in public offices and wealthy households.
They were also widely used for interior illumination, though mainly in public offices and wealthy households.

sen.j: 一般家庭にはあまり普及せず、石油ランプが一般的であった。
sen.e: However, they did not much penetrate common households, where oil lamps were generally used.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, they did not much penetrate common households, where oil lamps were generally used.
However, they did not much penetrate common households, where oil lamps were generally used.

sen.j: その後、白熱電球の発明と配電システムの普及により、屋内用の照明としてのガス灯は廃れていく事になる。
sen.e: Later, as interior lighting, they fell into disuse as the incandescent light bulb was invented and the power distribution system became widely available.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later, as interior lighting, they fell into disuse as the incandescent light bulb was invented and the power distribution system became widely available.
Later, as interior lighting, they fell into disuse as the incandescent light bulb was invented and the power distribution system became widely available.

sen.j: が、後述する通り街灯としては現在も僅かだが使用がみられる。
sen.e: As mentioned below, however, they are still used for street lighting to some extent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As mentioned below, however, they are still used for street lighting to some extent.
As mentioned below, however, they are still used for street lighting to some extent.

sen.j: またガス灯の燃料としての都市ガスの供給設備などのインフラは、調理用や暖房用のガス器具への燃料供給設備として、その後も整備が続けられ、現在に至る。
sen.e: The infrastructure for distributing gas fuels for lighting such as city gas distribution equipment has been continuously improved to this day, in order to provide fuels for gas cooking and heating equipment.

The infrastructure for distributing gas fuels for lighting such as city gas distribution equipment has been continuously improved to this day, in order to provide fuels for gas cooking and heating equipment.

The infrastructure for distributing gas fuels for lighting such as city gas distribution equipment has been continuously improved to this day, in order to provide fuels for gas cooking and heating equipment.

sen.j: ガス灯は電球の発達によって廃れていったが、現在もモニュメントとして照明にガス灯を使用している地域がある。
sen.e: Although gas lights became out of use as light bulbs developed, they are still used for monumental illumination in some regions.
Although gas lights became out of use as light bulbs developed, they are still used for monumental illumination in some regions.
Although gas lights became out of use as light bulbs developed, they are still used for monumental illumination in some regions.

sen.j: なお現存する最古のガス灯は兵庫県神戸市の相楽園内旧ハッサム住宅前にある。

sen.j: 兵庫県西宮市 市役所前。
sen.e: In front of the City Hall, Nishinomiya City, Hyogo Prefecture
In front of the City Hall, Nishinomiya City, Hyogo Prefecture
In front of the City Hall, Nishinomiya City, Hyogo Prefecture

sen.j: 姉妹都市より送られたもの。
sen.e: The gas lights have been given by Nishinomiya's sister city.
The gas lights have been given by Nishinomiya's sister city.
The gas lights have been given by Nishinomiya's sister city.

sen.j: 灯外内管・灯内内管
sen.e: External and Internal Gas Pipe
External and Internal Gas Pipe
External and Internal Gas Pipe

sen.j: 都市ガスの配管において、使用者の敷地内のガス設備を供給内管と言う。
sen.e: In city gas pipework gas equipment in the user's site is called an internal gas supply pipe.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In city gas pipework gas equipment in the user's site is called an internal gas supply pipe.
In city gas pipework gas equipment in the user's site is called an internal gas supply pipe.

sen.j: ガスメーターを挟んで、道またはボンベからメーターまでを灯外内管と言う。
sen.e: An external gas pipe refers to the pipe running from the street or gas cylinder to the gas meter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: An external gas pipe refers to the pipe running from the street or gas cylinder to the gas meter.
An external gas pipe refers to the pipe running from the street or gas cylinder to the gas meter.

sen.j: メーターから器具までの管を灯内内管と言う。
sen.e: An internal gas pipe refers to the pipe from the meter to the gas equipment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: An internal gas pipe refers to the pipe from the meter to the gas equipment.
An internal gas pipe refers to the pipe from the meter to the gas equipment.

sen.j: それはガス灯が盛んだった時代にガス灯内のガス管に使われていた名称の名残である。
sen.e: These names are remnants of those of the pipes for gas lights at the height of their use.
These names are remnants of those of the pipes for gas lights at the height of their use.
These names are remnants of those of the pipes for gas lights at the height of their use.
